ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: Since it is just a seminar where students hear lectures about the work and latest development in biostatistical research from scholars and no homework is assigned or exam scheduled, only one hour per week(the lecture time) is spent on this course.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Overall, the lectures are pretty inspiring and interesting. Sometimes we can hear most recent development and innovative ideas in biostatistical research from scholars overall the country, sometimes we can get practical information about employment from leaders in pharmaceutical companies. Those are the advantages. However, the work reported by the speakers is sometimes too theoretical and not easy to understand and follow. But overall, it's a very useful course.
This was a seminar course so there isn't anything to assess. However, there should be refreshments.
It would be great if we had more diverse speakers from economics, policy, etc.
This course is very helpful for students intend to apply PHD programs and do some forefront research in related field.
Seminars were very informative. The panel about pharmaceutical companies were very helpful. It would be good if we can get more information sessions about potential career outlook in biostats.
It offered us a good chance to know more about biostatistics topics.
Seminar is good and it gives us a lot of chance to meet with the faculty from other university and to expose ourselves to a bunch of different research area.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Excellent, very helpful
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Dr. Wang performs pretty well in organizing the seminars.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  good. invite a bunch of professors with a variety of background from other universities.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The lectures are pretty inspiring and interesting. Sometimes we can hear most recent development and innovative ideas in biostatistical research from scholars overall the country, sometimes we can get practical information about employment from leaders in pharmaceutical companies. Those are the advantages. However, the work reported by the speakers is sometimes too theoretical and not easy to understand and follow if you don't have a solid math and stat background.
Great insight into the biostatistics field.
This course is very helpful for students intend to apply PHD programs and do some forefront research in related field.
It is a good course, from which we can learn a lot of stuffs that cannot be learned from the general course.
